metadata.name: Friends of Kiriba Ecosystem
metadata.description:
In Kiriba village, Kilifi, Kenya, a powerful model of ecosystem stewardship is taking root, blending ancestral wisdom, community collaboration, and cutting-edge digital tools. Around 60 families participate in local Mweria group, rotating labor associations where members support one another in home repairs, gardening, infrastructure building, and community care. These groups embody long-standing traditions of mutual aid, where commitments are tracked through trust, memory, and shared intention.
At the center of this effort is the Friends of Kiriba Ecosystem Pool, a collective that curates and supports these groups using the Commitment Pooling Protocol—a framework inspired by natural systems like mycorrhizal fungi and traditional social coordination practices. This protocol guides the community’s coordination through four core functions: Curation, Valuation, Limitation, and Exchange. Using the Sarafu Network, a blockchain-based platform developed by Grassroots Economics, community members express and exchange commitments. Each collective action—whether planting food forests, building water features, or restoring sacred forests—is tracked and honored. Stewardship certificates validate these acts, turning them into assets for the commons.
Kiriba is becoming a living laboratory for regenerative practices—reviving degraded land, strengthening social bonds, and modeling a new kind of economy rooted in trust, reciprocity and care. It's not just about restoring ecosystems, but also relationships—with the land, each other, and tradition. Kiriba offers a vision of a grassroots-led, abundant future where community, culture, and nature thrive together.

data.title: Checkdams construction
data.description: Mnyumbuni demo farm in Kiriba Village protects a valley of indigenous trees. The valley is suffering erosion and the forest around is still young We implemented 15 checkdams along the gullies formed by the rains.

data.title: Trees identification and seed collection
data.description: We are collecting a participatory local plant database , gathering the traditional knowledge with the local communities We are building guilds of plants for food, medicine, firewood, hardwood and handcrafts and also planning with drought resistant species

data.title: Food diversity
data.description: We selected a number of fruit trees and some vegetable seeds to start producing more food and diversifying crops We are connecting this activity to soil certificates as well as nurseries and seedlings require good soil. We integrated vermicompost and biopreparation for plant growth.

data.title: Soil building
data.description: We started new compost piles. We prepared seaweed extract for the plants and made soil tests in different parts of the shamba to get to know more about our soil profile

data.title: Cleaning and mulching
data.description: 18 members came to help Anthony Kalume clean around posho mill. We also use the grass on mulching around big trees

data.title: Soil regeneration and nursery development
data.description: Working at Mnyumbuni demo farm in Kiriba Village : improving soil quality, biomass accumulation and erosion control as well as developing the trees and vegetable nurseries.

data.title: Water retention landcape and erosion control
data.description: We implemented checkdams in the valley to tackle erosion control and water infiltration in the soil including water retention landscaping

data.title: Local food production and syntropic agroforestry
data.description: Another beautiful day focusing on what nourishes us, taking care of the place we live in, singing traditional songs for nature and people care and we finished with a good meal. Thanks to the cook that are also part of the cycle of our farm to table project.

data.title: Soil building and vetiver grass
data.description: We planted Vetiver grass to mark several areas of Mnyumbuni compound as well as planting around retention beds in a fence area of the garden. We also used the vetiver to plant around young trees to create a protection, shade and microclimate around it.

data.title: Terracing and biomass management
data.description: We used logs, stones and branches to mark the edges, which also created a microhabitat for small animals as well as water accumulation in the soil. We refilled with some earth that was accumulated in another part of the land in order to build more soil, like raised beds techniques.

data.title: Collecting building soil
data.description: 13 people for mnyumbuni neighbors group came together to help Agnes Karisa collect building soil, every member came with a bucket, some came with jembes. After digging, we designed the place to look like a pond where Agnes Karisa could even use to collect rainwater.

data.title: Soap Making
data.description: Five members for mnyumbuni neighbors today came together and help mama salama mbeyu make soap for their home use.

data.title: Digging septic tank
data.description: 9 members for mnyumbuni neighbors came together this morning to help mama rehema garama dig a septic tank ,we managed to dig about 3 feets deep since the area is so compacted.

data.title: Road repair and tree planting strategies
data.description: We have been reinforcing the base of the gabions to help make the water spread, sink and slow. preparing tree holes on the highest part of the gabions, surrounded by interconnected half moon shapes to help collect water.

data.title: Making makuti
data.description: 14 members for kiriba mweria cycle today came together and help kalama kea make makuti,we managed to make 30 pieces in one and a half hour.

data.title: Cultivation and Farm Preparation
data.description: Eleven members for mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help mama kadzo karisa caltivat her small farm next to her house, and in two hours we managed to do three quarters of her land that she set aside for farming.

data.title: Collecting Manure
data.description: As a way for preparing for cultivation, upendo vikolani members are collecting cow dung manure inorder to scatter it on the uncultivated shamba.This helps to improve the fertility of the soil hence increasing the productivity of the crops.

data.title: Digging soil for building mud house walls
data.description: 8 members for mnyumbuni neighbors came together this morning to help salama mbeyu dig soil for building her mud house walls.

data.title: Making Syntropic Beds
data.description: Members from mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help Joyce kalume make syntropic beds.

data.title: Planting Maize
data.description: Members for Upendo came together this morning to help Joyce Jumwa plant maize,we managed to plant about half acre this morning in one and a half hour.

data.title: Pruning and Reinforcing Check Dams
data.description: 13 members for kiriba mweria cycle group today came together and help mama nyevu kahindi to do pruning and reinforcing her check dam through weaving

data.title: Planting and Making Syntropic Beds
data.description: Members for kiriba mweria cycle group today came together and help mama Lydia Sidi plant cassava and also they helped her make 2 syntropic beds for planting vegetables,it took us one and a half hour to do all activities.

data.title: Farm Making
data.description: 11 members for Mnyumbuni neighbors group came together and help mama Kadzo karisa to clear a bush and also help her in digging to prepare her small farm next to her house.
